intro: Hieracium montsanticola, commonly known as the Montsantic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium montsanticola is often found in meadows and slopes at higher elevations, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
